title: Any dealers you know of to recommend for a 722 redemption loan?
question: I was approved for a replacement car loan thru the 722 redemption but the lenders the bank put me in touch has only 3 cars available for me and they are not very reliable according to reviews. Trying to find deAlers who work with 722 redemptionto be able to return my actual car To the lender
answers: I agree. I would recommend waiting until after you get your discharge and check around for local dealers that have a "bankruptcy program". They will usually be able to put you into a car at a much better rate than the typical 24% from a "722" lender.

Dealers do not do that. Heir are a few companies around that do it. However, you must be certain that math works after all costs and fees.

The 722 redemption program has, in my experience, been a bust. While I understand you want to wrap up a deal now, once you get your discharge, plenty of lenders will be happy to finance you for any vehicle of the thousands available for sale on the lots in your community.
